Review: The Inter-University Drama Festival

York Uni hosts the Inter-University Drama Festival 2013, showcasing student talent from all over the country. Jordan Licht reviews the weekend's action.

Are Opera and Ballet Elitist?

By James Bithell

Ballet and opera have long been seen as the epitome of high culture and art. Amy Blumsom ponders about how, at the end of the day, they're both forms of art.

Review: Mark Hearld: A First Book of Nature

By James Bithell

Roisin Astell finds a modest selection of some of Hearld's finest artworks.

Jonny Walker's Battle for Music and Public Space

By James Bithell

Jonny Walker, busker and wandering troubadour, writes of his battle to save music in public spaces

Review: Mama

By James Bithell

Mama bears Del Toro's imprint and will scare its audience, when they're not laughing.

The Law In These Parts

By James Bithell

An award-winning documentary questions the discriminatory laws imposed upon Palestine by Israel, screened for the Human Rights Watch Film Festival

Murder, sex and divorce: Popes of the past

As Pope Francis takes his place as the new leader of global Catholicism, Shaun Richardson looks back at a small selection of these Popes and the events that marked their offices.

By James Bithell

Bringing in a new series for the Food and Drink section, Sunaina introduces a cheat cake. For those times when nothing but cake will do.

Review: Side Effects

By James Bithell

This clinically cool pyscho-thriller loses a star for relapsing into a conventional narrative. Tom Lubek reviews

By James Bithell

Album Review: Suede - Bloodsports

By James Bithell

After 11 years away, Suede return with new album 'Bloodsports'. Callum Reilly reviews.

Review: Dog Days

By James Bithell

A crime becomes news, becoming a film, becoming a play. James Soldan's examination of media action transfixes the Drama Barn with twisted thrill. Lucie Parker reviews.

Tortured by the police

Thenral tells Laura Hughes about how his life was changed forever, by a single day in July 2008, when he was abducted by the police.

Review: Oz the Great and Powerful

By James Bithell

With Oz transformed and its wizard well cast, Disney invokes more than nostalgia. Ruth Bury reviews

Review: Play in a Day

Beautifully unironed and endearingly comical, Dramasoc's termly Play in a Day festival is the kind of eccentric fun that so many great men and women grew up on. Sam Hickford reviews.

Manet: Portraying Life

By James Bithell

Lauded as an exhibition that produces a 'blast of fresh air', making the public 'sit up and pay attention', the Royal Academy exhibition has been causing quite a stir in the art world. Roisin Astell reviews.

Review: Wentworth Comedy Festival

By James Bithell

A marathon of stand-up and a showing of York's improv outfit, The Shambles, this Wentworth event show-cased much of the fantastic comic talent that York has to offer.

Review: An evening of Drawing Blood

By James Bithell

This one-night-only exhibition at the Norman Rea Gallery showcased political cartoons from caricaturists who draw between the prescribed lines of state censorship

Review: Oliver!

By James Bithell

Oliver! in York provides a sparkling night of familiar songs and captivating action. Ellie Wright reviews.

Candid images taken backstage at the Ekaterina Kukhareva Autumn/Winter '13 show at Fashion Scout.

Interview with Camilla Babbington

By James Bithell

Laura Hughes talks to model Camilla Babbington about the pressures and rewards of working in an industry obsessed with looks.

Meatless Monday: Soups Galore

Amadea Ng brings a variety of soups to the table to satisfy your veggie fix of the week.

Review: Stoker

By James Bithell

Joseph Harrison finds that Chan-wook Park's latest is a uniquely stylised and gloriously sinister modern gothic thriller

Review: The Resistance is Not Futile

Poppy Bullard talks to the Norman Rea's latest artist, Frances Copeman, about her exhibition 'The Resistance is not Futile'.

Review: YO1 Presents The Dub Lounge at The Courtyard

By James Bithell

Rory Foster tells you what went down this Saturday gone at the Courtyard
